section.p: A government bond with a maturity of 5 years annually pays 3.5% interest rate. Suppose you want to have $300,000 over 5 years, how much do you need to invest in this bond? Use Excels function for present value (PV) to calculate the answer.

section.title: Solution
section.p: The result of this formula is negative because it represents money that you need to pay, an expense. To get a positive answer you can put a minus for the formula or insert a negative value for the present value (-300000).
